metadata.title: CVE-2022-41723 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumptionin the HPACK decoder, sufficient to cause a denial of service from a smallnumber of small requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-golang-x-net-dev - 1:0.7.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

google-guest-agent - 20230426.00-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

golang-1.21 - 1.20.1-1
golang-1.21-go - 1.20.1-1
golang-1.21-src - 1.20.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-golang-x-net package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.7.0+dfsg-1').
google-guest-agent package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20230426.00-0ubuntu2').
golang-1.21 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.20.1-1').
